message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.CC, cs.SI 

Reasoning: The paper deals with the theory of erasure codes for distributed storage, which is a topic that falls under the intersection of several sub-fields in computer science. The paper's focus on characterizing the optimal rate of an LR code and developing tight bounds on the sub-packetization level of RG codes suggests that it belongs to the information theory (cs.IT) and distributed computing (cs.DC) sub-categories. The paper's contributions to the theory of LR and RG codes also make it relevant to the distributed systems (cs.DS) and coding theory (cs.CC) sub-categories. Finally, the paper's focus on constructing low field size Maximal Recoverable codes suggests that it may also be relevant to the signal processing (cs.SI) sub-category.
